How can I park a conversion of VRSCTEST to a new token, and later create a new token that can be converted to with either the new token or VRSCTEST, using the Verus command line?

To park a conversion of VRSCTEST to a new token, you can use the `sendcurrency` command with the `preconvert` option. This will effectively park your conversion until the new token launches. Here's an example of how to do this:

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"your_address@","convertto":"new_token","preconvert":1,"amount":100}]'
```

This command will park your conversion of 100 VRSCTEST to `new_token` until `new_token` launches. Once `new_token` launches, you will either find the converted amount of `new_token` in your wallet, or you will have your original VRSCTEST amount returned.

Later, if you want to create a new token called `mycoin` that can be converted to with either `new_token` or VRSCTEST, you can use the `definecurrency` command. Here's an example of how to do this:

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":33, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["VRSCTEST", "new_token"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":20000'
```

This command defines a new token named `mycoin`. The `currencies` option specifies that `mycoin` can be converted to with either VRSCTEST or `new_token`. The `minpreconversion` option specifies the minimum amounts of VRSCTEST and `new_token` needed to convert to `mycoin`, respectively. The `initialsupply` option sets the initial supply of `mycoin` to 20,000 units.

Note that the `proofprotocol` option is set to 2, which means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins.

dcurrency "*" '[{"address":"mike@","convertto":"gold","preconvert":1,"amount":100}]'
```
that would effectively park my conversion until the token launches, at which point, I will either find 0.975 GOLD in my wallet, or I will have my VRSCTEST back.
